intro: Elaeosticta bucharica, commonly known as the Bukharan elaeosticta, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its deep root system. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish in color, and it produces small, dry pods that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
